capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Snape's family history and it turns out he has a pretty complicated lineage. Apparently, his mother was a Muggle, which makes him a half-blood wizard, but then you also have to consider that his father is believed to be Tobias Snape, who was a member of the Death Eaters...

You know, I've always been fascinated by the complexities of the wizarding world. The fact that Snape's lineage is a mix of both pure-blood and Muggle heritage really adds depth to his character, don't you think? It makes him more relatable, yet still maintains an air of mystery surrounding him.

So, I was reading about Snape's family history and it turns out he has a pretty complicated lineage. His mother, Eileen Prince, was a witch, but his father, Tobias Snape, was a Muggle. That's what makes him a mixed-wizard, which is really interesting. (sentiment: neutral)
